Reviews.Title: Good looking TV--very basic in features. Other review is false.
Reviews.Author: Mohammed
Reviews.Content: I would like to start my review by commenting on the other review. I viewed the TV at Costco and it is, in fact, NOT the same TV. It has the same specs, but is not in fact the same model number. The TV at Costco had a much more dull, inaccurate color to it as well. I think this is the difference between this tv and the UW40TC1W.On the TV itself: The TV's picture is really good for the money. I am using a Dish Satellite with a Joey Hopper and it looks great. I use it in my bedroom and lie about 8-10 feet away (head to screen). I hooked up my BR Drive and the picture was clear and crisp (not vivid or exciting like a Samsung, but still very good). (Make sure your input is set to 1080p--I was watching 480p until I realized there was a difference in my Dish Joey settings).Pros: Price, picture, size, LED, 120Hz, 1080p, calibration presetsCons: Basic remote, lackluster feature set (hard to adjust and calibrate picture, but see above), not smart TV, and no "smooth motion setting"Overall, the TV is priced right, but not a 5 start TV at all. Given the price, I can only knock one star. It is what it is and it's not trying to be anything it isn't. See cons.Update: Wanted to add that I have not attempted to mount this. The TV is breaking in some and looks better every week to me. I have used it with my HP DV7 to play Bluray and they look pretty darned good. I also hooked it up to my desktop via my GTX295 and enjoyed COD4 and BFBC2 with lots of immersion. I have always wanted to play on something this large. Paired with the GTX295 and an HDMI cable, games look great with little screen lag.Side note: I received the TV with absolutely 0 dead pixels or any other cosmetic issues. I might just be lucky, but in the some 12 devices I have owned with flat panels, only my PSP had a single dead pixel. I feel terribly sorry for those with as many as 5-6 with any given brand, but no issues at all here!

Reviews.Title: Tricky to mount, but here's the secret.
Reviews.Author: Joshua Merrill
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV on 11/26/12 (that's Cyber Monday, if you're keeping track). It arrived a couple days later, and everything in the box was in good shape and worked perfectly.The Westinghouse UW40T2BW is a no-frills TV, so there's very little to set up. I connected my Apple TV to it and everything worked great. The picture and sound quality are surprisingly good for a budget TV, and the thin bezel puts the focus on what's *on* the screen instead of what's around it. The TV is slim and weighs less than 30 pounds, making it ideal to mount.About that. Amazon describes this TV as VESA 200mm x 200mm--it isn't. It's a non-standard size, and the molding in the back makes it even harder to properly attach a mount. I tried three different mounts, and the one that ultimately worked was the Sanus AMF112-B1. (I had to purchase it at Target, but if you can get it on Amazon, all the better.) The mount is adjustable for non-standard sizes, and includes spacers, which you'll need to use.I'm very happy with this TV and would recommend it to others. But if you're going to mount it, save yourself the headache, learn from my experience, and get the Sanus AMF112-B1.

Reviews.Title: If you want a 40 inch tv with 120hz and 1080p, stop your search here
Reviews.Author: MMO Man "gioacchino"
Reviews.Content: I almost didn't buy this set after weeks of research leading up to Thanksgiving. The other negative reviews that I read convinced me I should fork out for a more expensive set.I am sensitive to issues others had with dead pixels or problems, but I had no such issues and can only comment on the tv assuming that you get a unit with no problems.The picture is extremely vibrant and rich. Do I notice some differences with higher end sets in terms of sharpness?  Sure. Is there minimal increased motion blur. Sure. But, honestly, I had to really, really, really focus on the screen and stare for hours to notice anything at all.Additionally, if you are hooking up to a computer, like I did for 1080p gaming in Assassin's Creed 3 and Hitman Absolution, the screen has a special setting for super fast response times for pc usage. Max resolution is also 1920x1080. My games looked amazing in this setting and I was so happy.I purchased this set at Micro Center in Cambridge for $299, although the deal here is good too, although local chains might have even lower pricing.Many of the parts for this set are made by the same factory as Toshiba. To get a set in which you definitely notice a difference in screen quality, I honestly think you would have to spend $700-800.Given I got a TV that, sincerely, I believe is 90% as good for half the price, I am very happy and justify five stars based on quality for the price.I am a big audio/videophile person, but given how inexpensive this was, I thought I would give Westinghouse a try and I'm really happy I did.Two more little notes: I had to play with the brightness/contrast, etc, to get the screen to look its best. This was well worth the effort and you will find many guides that given suggestions. I suggest putting the brightness higher than what you would think and using the cool setting for colors as well as the pc setting for the picture.Finally, I tested the set with a number of friends' HDMI splitters and it worked flawless with all of them.Also, aesthetically the set is very thin and nice looking, installs easily to the base, views well from angles and does not generate much heat.I can't recommend this set enough. Consider pairing it with a Geforce 670 GTX :)

Reviews.Title: No Frills, Crazy Wall Mount, High Value
Reviews.Author: Nerd Alert
Reviews.Content: My first HDTV was a Westinghouse, and I was thrilled!  It was around 8 years ago, and things have changed quite a bit.  Standards are higher and prices are lower.  With so many companies trying to get our attention, can Westinghouse still compete in the low end market?BUILDMy first impression of this TV was, "This is a Westinghouse?  It looks fancy."  The bezel is nicely understated and pretty thin, and the TV is very slim considering the low price.  Compared to the Seiki TV I recently reviewed, this TV looks like it is from the future.  It does not look like a $1000+ TV, but it doesn't look cheap.The USB port can't be used for pictures or movies. It is for firmware updates, if the TV ever needs them, and would most likely be used only by a repair technician. The port does provide the 5V signal if you need it for a peripheral such as a USB Wii sensor bar.The Westinghouse I bought 8 years ago was built like a tank.  When it recently died, I took it apart and it was full of thick metal.  Similarly, the stand was very heavy duty.  The stand for the UW40T2BW is pretty flimsy in comparison, though I think it will hold up decently.  The TV does easily wobble and needs to be somewhere very stable, though there is an included hole to screw it to the furniture if that is an option.  My TV stand has a glass top.PICTURE QUALITYIf you want chromaticity diagrams of the standard color spaces, I have uploaded them to the image gallery. If you don't know what they mean, the gist is that the color reproduction is pretty standard to better than average for a low end TV.  However, some areas look a bit blotchy.  This is probably not the panel's inadequacy, but some sort of processing that is done to the picture.  Unfortunately, processing can not be turned off on this TV.  Still, I was very happy with the picture quality for the most part after calibration, and 1080p movies looked great.LCD TVs used to be awful with quick motion, such as a camera panning across a scene.  My old TV left a smeary trail.  This is not an issue with most newer TVs, but still is in some at the lowest price range.  Thankfully, the UW40T2BW had no such issues.  The only problem is that there are no options for the way it converts standard frame rates to 120 Hz (motion interpolation, etc.).  Sound like techno babble?  If you've seen a fancy TV make everything look a bit sped up, you've seen a perhaps overdone version of motion interpolation.  Some people love it after they adapt, while others hate it.  Most TVs have an option to adjust it, but the UW40T2BW has one setting, which is pretty subtle.If you are planning to use a TV as a computer monitor, I think it is worth considering this one.  It has a true 1:1 mode, so there is no issue with overscan.  However, with black text on grey, there is sometimes a garbled color field around the text.  This may be the result of the same processing that makes some imagery look a bit smeared.  It is not an issue for most webpages I viewed.EDIT:  I forgot to mention that this TV has wide viewing angles.  I can look at it from a pretty sharp angle before the picture washes out, and even then it looks pretty good.WALL MOUNTINGI would generally not include anything about mounting in my reviews, since I've mounted many TVs and the process is always the same.  However, looking at the back of this TV will give you an immediate migraine if you are planning to mount it.  It is almost like they intentionally sabotaged anyone who would dare try.  The screw holes are place next to a recessed area, so you won't have access to them without building out some strange structure with spacers.While I'm sure that where there is a will, there is a way, I highly suggest looking elsewhere if you plan to mount your TV.  Even if you figure out a way to do it, it will probably look like a mess.EDIT:  There was a will and a way.  Joshua Merrill wrote a review in which he describes the issues with wall mounting.  The size is not the standard one in Amazon's description.  He found that the Sanus AMF112-B1 did the trick.  If you plan to mount the TV, I suggest reading his review and giving him a helpful vote.  I don't know why Westinghouse made it so difficult/specific, but at least there is a solution.  The downside is that this is not an ultra flush type mount.  Those are both cheap and look really nice on thin TVs like this one.  Ah well.Big_G also let me know that he was able to do it in the comments, and I am hoping he will give us pictures and more information.  His approach seems to be more DIY (just buy longer screws and add spacers/shims until it works).  If you go this route, make sure to properly match the threading of the screws to avoid making a return trip to the hardware store.SOUNDLike most modern HDTVs, the speakers on the UW40T2BW do not point forward, giving the sound an echo.  It is sufficient for basic use and I forgot about it a few minutes into a movie.REMOTEThe remote is very basic. It is not super intuitive and does not light up, but it is okay. It requires pointing at the TV.OVERALLIf you plan to mount your TV, stay away from the UW40T2BW, unless you are looking for a challenge and a trip to the hardware store (but see edit above).  Otherwise, I have been very pleased with the picture, apart from some splotchy color areas here and there.  Motion looks very nice, and the overall package compares very well to other TVs in the same price range.  It is great to see Westinghouse remain competitive.

Reviews.Title: size/price sweet spot
Reviews.Author: J-J-J-Jinx!
Reviews.Content: This tv hits the size/price sweet spot. It's big enough for an enjoyable viewing experience in a small to medium bedroom or a small living room or a dorm room, but small enough to keep the price low. The quality is not amazing or anything...you get okay sound (although a separate surround sound system of course would be much better) a pretty good picture and all the basics. Six years ago I purchased a 42" hdtv and I paid 3 times the MSRP that this one is advertised for (which is more than Amazon's actual price.) My previous tv was a higher quality, it seemed sturdier with a heavy duty construction and was still going strong after six years (when I rehomed it) and had a better warranty (this one is one year for parts and one year "limited" for labor) but if you are looking for an "interim" tv, something better than what you had before or something for your kids to take away to college (some people may think it's a ridiculous size for that, but for many I think it hits the sweet spot for "right tv for kids away at college") while you wait for 1.) your kids to start making their own money or 2.) some of the larger tvs with 3d and smart tv and everything else features to come down in price.What I like about the tv (it's inexpensive and practically disposable) is also what I really don't like about it: a "disposable tv", not built to last. Very wasteful. My mom has a tv she still uses that's about 40 years old...I'd be somewhat surprised if this one lasted even 1/8th of that.Here are the specs I found for this model (don't know why they weren't listed here):Warranty Terms - Parts 1 yearWarranty Terms - Labor 1 year limitedWidth 38 inchesWeight 29.4 lbs. with stand (27 lbs. without)TV Type LED Flat-PanelScreen Size Class 40"Screen Size (Measured Diagonally) 40" Size of the screen, in inches, measured diagonally from corner to corner.Vertical Resolution 1080p Maximum number of horizontal lines (or pixels) that can be displayed from the top of the TV screen to the bottom. The greater the number of lines, the better the picture.Screen Refresh Rate 120HzProduct Height (with stand) 26-1/2"Product Height (without stand) 24"Product Depth (with stand) 8"HDMI Inputs 2 HDMI carries both digital video and audio (at resolutions up to 1080p) in a single cable. It provides the highest-quality connection between your TV and Blu-ray players, personal computers, video game consoles and more. The more inputs your TV has, the more devices you can connect directly.USB Port Yes, for firmware upgrade onlyUSB Input YesComponent Video Inputs 1Composite Inputs 1Media Card Slot No Slot designed to accept 1 or more types of media card (aka, memory card), such as Secure Digital or CompactFlash. A device with a media card slot can access and/or store photos, audio, video and/or other files on a compatible media card.Watts/Channel 10 Power per speaker. The higher the power, the louder the sound.Speakers 2Speaker Output Power 20WV-Chip Yes Allows parents to select which show ratings are appropriate for their children and block other content. Parents can override the system using a secret code.Power Consumption (watts) Stand-by <1ENERGY STAR Certified YesMount Bracket/VESA Pattern 200mm x 200mmAspect Ratio 16:9 Describes the relationship between the width and the height of a display. Standard displays are 4:3, while widescreen displays are 16:9.Maximum Resolution 1920 x 1080Dynamic Contrast Ratio 100,000:1PC Inputs 1 Inputs that allow you to connect the TV to your PC for use as a computer monitor.RF Antenna Input 1 Jack for connecting an antenna to receive over-the-air television broadcasts.Audio Outputs 2 Jacks that send audio signals to another A/V component.Speaker Location Down-firingLanguage Options English, French, SpanishSleep Timer Yes Allows you to set the device to turn on (alarm) or off (sleep) after a specific amount of time.Remote Control Type Standard Type of remote included to control functions from a distance. Universal remotes control multiple components regardless of manufacturer, while learning remotes can be programmed to control nonstandard functions.Power Consumption (watts) Power On 90Headphone Jacks Yes Outputs that allow the connection of headphones using 1/8" (mini) or 1/4" (phone) jacks.Ethernet Port NoEnergy Consumption (kWh/year) 121.1Estimated Yearly Operating Cost $13.32

Reviews.Title: Nice TV, HORRIBLE mounting system and false advertising!
Reviews.Author: BMaster
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying this TV has a nice picture and a great price and if your not wall mounting this TV then don't hesitate to buy it.However if you do plan to wall mount your new TV, DO NOT BUY THIS MODEL! First off it is advertised at 200 x 200 VESA mount, this is a lie! Look up the manual online and it will tell you the mount is 266mm x 275mm! So then you think, well as long as i just get a tilt mount with 2 vertical 'hook' brackets for the back then it shouldn't be an issue, WRONG! The back of the TV has a raised section in the middle where the computer board and TV inputs are located, so majority of the TV is .5" thick, but then in the middle of the back there is a raised section that is about 1" - 1.5" thicker than the rest of the TV. There are inputs on the side and bottom of this raised section. The mounting holes are on the skinny part of the tv, RIGHT NEXT TO THE RAISED SECTION! so you have absolutely no way to get a mounting bracket up against the holes, and even if you could you would be blocking inputs, including the power input! Then you think, well most mounts come with spacers so you should be able to use those, NOPE! this raised area is so much higher that 2 different mounts spacers were not thick enough. So in order to get this mounted I had to go to the hardware store and get PVC pipe to use as spacers, and longer screws to hold the brackets. I ended up getting the thing mounted, but it took a trip to the hardware store and allot of messing around.

Reviews.Title: Westinghouse UW40T2BW
Reviews.Author: L. Mcdermott
Reviews.Content: Purchased both the TV and a Cheetah wall mount at the same time. TV arrived in 3 days, the wall mount took a week. As stated in earlier reviews, the wall mount holes on the back of the TV casing were too close to the raised area that houses the ports for the verticle bar on the mount to align with the mounting holes. I had to go to the store and purchase 1 inch plastic spacers and 4, 6M x 40 mm mounting bolts to build it up to mount the brackets. So the TV sits about 3" from the wall instead of under 2 inches that I was hoping for.The picture quality is very good and the slim bezel design looks like that of a more expensive TV. Overall, I am happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: READ THIS BEFORE YOU CLICK ADD TO CART
Reviews.Author: S. Wyatt
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV in December 2012.  Arrived promptly and in good shape.  6 months later the right half of the screen started getting colored lines, TV would warm up and be OK in a few minutes.  By 7th month no picture on right side.  Still under warranty, so contact Westinghouse.  After supplying info and pictures they issued a Return Merchandise Authorization code and would replace TV.  HERE IS THE CATCH - only place to return to is in California, I live in Virginia.  I am responsible for return shipping (they will ship refurbished one to me once they receive my shipment).  I am responsible for damage in shipment.  Packing and shipping is app. $300!  I end up paying $668.00 for a refurbished TV (original price $368 + $300 shipping).  I will be contacting Amazon about this supplier!

Reviews.Title: Defective Product - But Terrible Customer Service
Reviews.Author: RVonderheide
Reviews.Content: TV Turns on and off by itself--- Volume goes up on its one.  Spent months back and forth with Westinghouse without callback without resolutions.  As I can see many other customers for many different Westinghouse TV's that the Customer support is terrible.  But I took a chance with the TV since I had a different TV from them and it worked OK.  But if you get a bad one, and it seems like there are many out there who got the bad ones, Westinghouse is terrible to deal with.  You can never get a hold of them --- Probably since there are so many people complaining.Thank you Amazon for taking this back!

Reviews.Title: Not hard to wall mount with the right parts
Reviews.Author: Michael Winger
Reviews.Content: Everyone else covers the quality of this TV pretty well, but no one really explains how to wall mount it. Here's what I did:I already had a wall mount from Monoprice. I took the screws that came with it and made sure they fit into the new TV - just to make sure the threading is the same. I went to the hardware store and matched the threading with nuts until I figured out what it was. Once I had the threading, I found:- Four 40mm screws that match the threading of the screws in my wall mount. Mine were "M6" (This is simply the ISO metric standard of describing the threading, or if the screw will screw into where you need it to.)- Four 1-inch tall spacers that will work with the screws you just found.Basically, the problem everyone is having with this TV is that the space between the mount point where the screws go in from wall mount brackets of ANY kind is shallow by an inch. You have to resolve this by using (1-inch) spacers, and consequently (1-inch) longer screws. Cost me $5 at a hardware store and a total of 1 hour to get this thing from inside the box to on my wall. Come on people! It's easy!

Reviews.Title: A 40 inch tv that's as useless as it is beautiful
Reviews.Author: ecasillas
Reviews.Content: I got this TV on sale for what I thought was a pretty good deal. I was seduced by its sleek looks, sultry thin bezel, and brushed grey complexion.Unfortunately when I got home to turn it on, the problems that plague it to this day became apparent :(It's possible I received a bad apple, but given some of the other reviews here, and the problems I've seen people bring up to @WestinghouseTV on twitter, and the now mysteriously vanished Westinghouse Facebook page, I now conclude this might just be a badly designed television not worth anyone's money.To put it in the most relatable sense, this TV acts possessed. It turns on when it feels like it, to the point I have to unplug it before going to bed and to work. Nothing like coming home to a TV blasting (could hear it from when I left the elevator on my floor), that must have turned itself on at some point and had been playing at its loudest volume for hours. It was so loud I felt compelled to apologize to all of my lovely apartment building neighbors for the noise.On top of that, when I do turn it on purposely, it often decides that the channel I've chosen to watch is not the one it wants to play, and changes it. It likes to go channel by channel until it finds something to stop at for a few minutes, before continuing to change channels on its own. I can't decide whether this TV is so bad that I've lost all autonomy as a human, or if it's in fact so good, that it's been programmed to give me the remote-clicking-happy husband I never wanted.And then the volume. This TV is unhappy until the volume is raised the entire way up. It must be pretty excited to show off how good it's sound quality is. If you like your sound turned up all the way up, this TV is for you. For those with more sensible hearing preferences, good luck not getting entirely worked up in a remote war with a TV that ignores all commands and keep the volume up as high as possible. My favorite move is when I click "mute" and the TV silences for a second and then laughs in the face, barreling its loud sound at me once again. It's a war I wasn't meant to win.Owning this TV is like owning a Furby, except the Furby was cool for the first 16 hours.Avoid. Run. Or if you're lonely and seek companionship from a machine with a mind of its own, keep it for the lols.

Reviews.Title: Nice Affordable T.V. For Those on a Budget
Reviews.Author: RB24
Reviews.Content: I, like a few others, purchased this t.v. with some reservations at the cyber deal price of $299.00. It was received within 3 days and was nicely packaged. The t.v. is sleek and does not have the look of a "lower end" t.v. The picture, with a few adjustments, looks very nice and crisp. I have seen some other reviews about the complaints on the sound. I have this t.v. in my living room (vaulted ceiling) and it sounds great. Of course as with any t.v., having a surround system would provide much better sound. I am also a gamer, so for those people who like to play the video games, no worries there either. The only negatives I can say is the remote is pretty cheesy, like other posters have stated and if you do plan to mount the t.v., you will need to purchase some additional items (spacers and such)in addition to the mount. The design for a wall mount was not good. I have an entertainment center, so mounting it wasn't even a consideration. Overall, for the price, I would recommend this t.v. to anyone...even at the current price I believe it would still be a nice deal.

Reviews.Title: Returned twice!
Reviews.Author: Craig
Reviews.Content: Returned it twice (received different tv each time) because both tv's would change the volume, channel, and power on/off all by itself! I tried different outlets in the house and took the batteries out of the remote. I have no idea what would cause this because it would do it after hours of watching it without problems then it would change the channel or volume or both all at once. A few times I even came home to the tv blasting multiple times also and I only had these tv's for a total of 2 weeks.Definitely don't recommend, I wish I could offer some reason or idea what caused this to help your decision process, but I tried everything that I could think of.P.S. Amazon's return policy was amazing, nothing was paid out of pocket by me for the returns, etc.

Reviews.Title: Mounting and Brief TV Review
Reviews.Author: Derek
Reviews.Content: Setup: Mounted (Details at end of review noting why its difficult to mount)TV Review: I purchased this TV for $299 in an amazon daily deal and I must say that is an amazing steal. I would not pay more than $450 though as I think the engineering is a bit off on this one for mounting purposes. 120hz refresh rate is nice as it creates a little bit smoother picture. Overall I would say this is an extremely nice LOW END tv. If you are a TV guru and want something amazing for friends to gauk at, go with something $1000-$2000 more like a sony as this is not your TV. If you want a good tv to play some video games, or watch some football this is good enough without getting to the 'Walmart" quality TVs.Picture Quality: Quality is good, lacking in the contrast department a little as its only 4000:1 ratio unlike the false 100k posting on sites. I have it in a very bright room and it fairs well enough that I could not harp on its brightness/contrast issues.Features: I really like the remote even though its super old school/basic. It has favorite channel buttons which works well for my setup since its not connected to a cable box.Looks: Brushed bezel on the front looks really nice, makes it look more expensive than it was. It is also a thin bezel around the edges so it looks sleek and doesn't take a large area for a tv this size. Its also very thin other than the bulge at the bottom and middle on the backside of the TVPorts: I would say avg. to above avg. It has a usb port which some will like for digital cameras, video recorders, 'rail camera's for those hunters out there. Also has 2 HDMI ports which is the lowest amt I would go.Details how I mounted: First of all mounting this specific TV is not for the faint of heart. Luckily I was a little creative and had some tools to make this really simple. Mounted this with the VideoSecu Ultra Slim TV Wall Mount at http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B003GRW1KQ/ref=oh_details_o01_s00_i00 for under $20. I gave this mount 5 stars and could not rave enough about its awesome engineering. I think the person that engineered this mount should have engineered this TV as its a polar opposite. You have to use 1" spacers with this TV regardless of the mount because the the back of the TV sticks out too far. Unfortunately this mount only came with .75" spacers and a trip to the hardware store was needed. Even with the spacers you run into a situation where you cant get your fingers into the coaxial port to screw the cable in. (HDMI is not an issue its on the bottom and doesn't require spinning.) Thus, my solution was to make (i'm sure they sell them cheap somewhere) a 3" coaxial extension for the cable with a female-female connector to extend out of the blocked area from the mount and basically make it easier to connect to the cable, I did that first before I put hte mounting bracket on which covers up the ports and then makes it difficult to get to.If you use this mount  you will need 2 people to hang it at the end of the install - 1 person to hold the TV close to the cords, and another to make all the connections BEFORE you hang it. Reason being is that its so close to the wall that you cant get your hands in to make the connections and the bulge in the back bottom part of the tv blocks our fingers.That said, I liked having it this close to the wall because it looks really nice and professional when complete. Mounted, the VERY FRONT part of the tv is still only 3.5" from the wall (thats with mounting hardware+spacers+thickness of TV). That is very awesome if you consider a lot of other mounts/tvs as some tvs are 3.75" thick and they call that slim. Also this mount has side caps on the side to leave a nice side profile view of the bracket, versus jagged edges and metal being seen.Last thing to mention is that I referenced this mount so much because I couldn't believe how perfect it matched up with this tv down to the little things like: vertical bars do not stick out and work perfect with the bottom bulge on tv, width of the horizontal bracket is minimal but enough to suit, i did a pull-up (185lbs) on the bracket so I know it will hold a 30lbs tv, and it has quick release pull tabs to easily remove the tv for readjustment if needed all for under $20!!!!!!K- now back to watching Big Bang Theory on my new Westinghouse TV :)

Reviews.Title: tv turns on by it self
Reviews.Author: Inderpal Singh
Reviews.Content: this tv is possessed. it worked fine for the first couple of months. and now it urns on by it self???it does it even with the autosource feature turned off

Reviews.Title: Stopped working in four months
Reviews.Author: Brian A. Osborne
Reviews.Content: Stopped working in four months. Still under warranty. Contacted Westinghouse. Told me to ship it to them since they no longer fix them. Once the television was in route to them they would send out a replacement. Contacted them and they told me that they would not send out a new one until they recieved the old one. Have had the my television since April. Have still not recieved my replacement. They will not give me any answers over the phone. They only promise to email me the status which never happens. Everytime I call customer service I am put on hold and then disconnected half the time.  DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT. I have no issue with the Amazon Seller the product was shipped as promised. Just trying to warn consumers not to buy products from this particular manufacturer.

Reviews.Title: Very disapppointed
Reviews.Author: Penny
Reviews.Content: This TV turns itself on randomly, which has occurred a total of 7 times since it was delivered.  I called the manufacturer and was advised to disconnect from power and cable, wait 3 minutes, then reconnect. However it continues to turn itself on.  I've gotten out of bed a few times to come to the level of the house where it is placed to turn it off.  The cable box is off most of the time when this happens.  However, it does occur when the cable box is off, at which time there is only the TV screen on with no picture.  I had hopes that this would correct itself, but it appears that this is going to be an ongoing problem, so I regretfully will have to return it.  Please advise on return.Penny

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV for the price
Reviews.Author: BD223
Reviews.Content: I too was also able to snag this TV on cyber monday for $299. It arrived the next day and I was pleasantly surprised to find a TV that is incredibly sleek and stylish. The bezel is plastic but it's thin and has a nice dark gray streaked finish to it -- not the cheap glossy black plastic look of most lower end TVs. The picture is decent right out of the box and looked even better with some minor adjustments to the settings. I was anticipating the sound to be tinny based on some of the reviews -- but sound is good in my opinion. The remote does look a little cheap; however, it is simple to use and I like the individual input buttons at the bottom (HDMI 1, Video1, TV, HDMI 2, etc.). Westinghouse might not be a name brand in the LED market, but considering it's 40"/1080P/LED, you really can't go wrong for $299. Even at the normal Amazon price it's a bargain. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Good affordable HDTV
Reviews.Author: NewUser
Reviews.Content: As in all households, we had a long discussion whether to buy this TV or to buy a much more expensive one (>$550), with same specifications. My wife was skeptical at first because this is not a Samsung or an LG. But I persuaded her since we were getting this at $300, in the amazon cyber deal.I couldn't have been happier. We received it within 3 days, it is lightweight and easy to set up. The picture is superb. The only problem is that the remote is very basic and not universal.All in all, it looks like a steal of a buy for 300 bucks, when other companies are selling the same specification TVs for more than $500.

Reviews.Title: Lasted about 6 months
Reviews.Author: Emir
Reviews.Content: I bought the tv in March. Starting about a month ago, TV would turn on and off by itself, sometimes it would just not want to turn on at all, and others it would stay on, but it would be "possessed" (volume would go up and down, input settings would change, etc). Tried calling customer service (hard to get because they admitted they had phone issues... For over a week) and they determined it was a faulty unit and advised I return it and they'd send me a new one ... The problem is they wanted me to pay for shipping... Shipping is about half the cost of the TV, so I decided to throw it away and just buy a new Samsung... Tried brand.

Reviews.Title: Volume and remote don't work right
Reviews.Author: Robert Hardy
Reviews.Content: Some shows are plainer than others, the volume is not loud enough,but the music drowns out the words people are speaking.The background sounds are always too loud.We adjusted it all the ways the manual suggests, and the problem is still there..We reset back to original settings 8-10 times. We can't put in channel numbers,we have to take one channel at a time.This is a huge problem.We changed batteries in the remote a couple of times,and nothing helps.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: dawn
Reviews.Content: We bought this tv because it was rated so well...big mistake. Within 2 wks the tv's volume goes up VERY LOUDLY ON ITS OWN! Called the support line 15 times....waited on hold minimum 20mins each time...never got answer. Also, while son plays Xbox he gets kicked off several times and tv shuts off....very disappointed in tv and service

Reviews.Title: Nice picture and sound, great features
Reviews.Author: Koala1356
Reviews.Content: I have this hooked up to my XBOX 360 and my computer, both via the HDMI inputs. I use it primarily for XBOX gaming, DVD playback from my XBOX, watching videos (Youtube etc) via my PC, and some armchair gaming via my PC, etc etc.Connectors:* 2 x HDMI in* 1 x composite in (yellow/red/white)* 1 x VGA in (plus an input for computer sound)* 1 x coaxial antenna in* 1 x audio out (RCA red/white)* 1 x SPDIF outLikes:* Picture looks great when tweaked out to your preference.  As a computer monitor, this is one of the best I have tried.  There is a feature in the menu to turn off the Overscan, which means it exactly duplicates a PC monitor (no cut off edges).  Text is easy to read in the TV's native resolution of 1900x1080* Slim bezel.  Eyeballed, it looks smaller than my other 40-inch TVs but its viewable area is not. It just has a very attractive slim bezel that makes the overall dimensions of the TV smaller.* Very good sound system by Yamaha, including Surround Sound 3D.  Also, if you elect to hook this TV to an external sound source you can completely turn off the TV speakers in the menu (as opposed to muting them).* Matte finish screen.  I personally prefer this for gaming TV and computer monitor.  However, this means the colors are not quite as rich looking as what you would see on a glossy screen TV.  This is my personal observation.  Just saying.* Great menu features for a basic TV, such as Overscan control, TV speakers ON/OFF.* Remote features 8 buttons for all the input modes, as well as a single button that needs to be cycled.  The 8 buttons are much easier.Dislikes:* No paper manual in the box.  It's on a DVD (included).* HDMI inputs are on the back center and under a lip.  Cables connect in an awkward 'upward' direction.* Remote control has limited IR range and angle.  You have to be directly in front of the TV.* For the life of me, I can't get this TV to maintain the correct date and time settings.  Is it because it's not connected to a cable box/antenna and used primary as a playback/gaming monitor?  Don't know, but the clock is never correct.  Not a big deal for me.Overall, I really like this TV for my gaming and second computer monitor.  I prefer the matte screen for where I have this TV located (opposite a window), but other people have other opinions.  I agree that a glossy screen makes colors look richer, but I still think (to my eye) that this TV as a pretty nice picture once tweaked out to my preferences.  The 120HZ works very well--in fact better than the 120HZ on my 42-inch Panasonic.  For the price, this is a very nice TV (picture, sound, and features) and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: So Far....So Great!!
Reviews.Author: Solid
Reviews.Content: With the features of this TV...the price is amazing!  I know that Westinghouse does not have the best reliability in the industry....but so far I love it.Features: The TV has a great look to it. It is sleek and does not look cheap at all.  The stand is not like steel....but it will surely hold the TV for it's lifetime. It does not wobble and I am not concerned at all.Sound: All flat screens leave a lot to be desired in this area.....however...the sound is more than adequate. I never have to raise the volume past halfway and the sound quality is decent.RCA Audio Out Jacks: This is a must for me because sometimes I run this through my very high end stereo for movies or music concerts. Very few flat screens have this feature anymore. The trend is the little pin jack for computer speakers. I needed the RCA jacks and the sound is amazing. No noise like some reviewers have noted.I do have all my electronics gear protected by electrical conditioners and surge suppressors (monster power). This is something everyone should invest in for the life of any valued component.......period.Picture:  Out of the box.....the picture was very good......but I was not blown away. I learned that all manufactures "crank up" the video settings so that when a consumer views it in the store.....it will "pop" compared to the other brands. However in the home....in a much darker setting.....those settings are not realistic. All high def TV's have to be calibrated......period. Their capabilities far exceed what we are capable of without calibration tools. I invested in Disney's "World Of Wonder" TV setup disc. There are many discs out there....but Disney's seems to be the benchmark for home use. This must be played on a Blue ray player, but it comes with many test patterns and a color filter that you look through to adjust the color.After calibrating the TV...the picture is breathtaking!  If it were any better....the actors would be sitting in your lap!  I do not see how to obtain a better picture...regardless of price. It is seamless, smooth and almost looks 3-D. Best Buy charges $299 dollars to come to your home and perform a calibration!  That's how important it is!  I paid $15 for the disc......no brainer.Remote:  The remote is not the simplest or friendliest.....however it appears to be well made and it works!Summary: For this price.....this TV is simply amazing. If I have any problems...I will update this review. Until then...it rates 5 stars easily :)2/10/2013 UPDATE:  The power supply located on the power cord runs very hot..... 122 degrees!  It took 3 attempts to contact someone at customer service....and finally spoke with an individual that agreed with me and created a ticket and promised to send another one right out. That was 1/4/2013 and nothing yet. I am disappointed with customer service so far and dropped a star to reflect that. I will keep you posted.3/1/2013 UPDATE:  They finally sent a new cord / power inverter. This one is larger and better quality. It also run at 99 degrees...that's more like it! The TV is still great......keep ya posted on any changes.....

Reviews.Title: Just OK
Reviews.Author: StaceyG
Reviews.Content: Easy setup and start; takes a few seconds to turn on; sound is great; picture is the issue, not very HD but passable, contrast and sharpness appears pixilated.

Reviews.Title: Can't beat it for the price
Reviews.Author: John Jezl
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice, basic 40" 1080p LED TV. My 4 star review takes the $299 price I paid for it into consideration. It's not perfect. There are several shortcomings. But it has a clear, bright picture quality. I love it. I'm not an A/V connoisseur, so I may not be "seeing" shortcomings in this department. Then again, if you're that picky about your A/V, why are you buying something in this price range?The audio is nothing great, but at this price it's not going to be and fine for use in a bedroom. Besides, in general, these TVs are meant to be connected to a sound system. I plan to use mine with wireless headphones.Many reviewers have complained about the wall mount. I'm glad I didn't need to mount it. I can see what they are talking about. And if they are going to make it tough to mount, a little more attention to the stand quality would be nice.Pros: Picture quality, adequate audio quality, overall valueCons: Ugly remote with too many small buttons, barely adequate stand, odd connector placementAll-in-all, it's a very nice value-priced TV.

Reviews.Title: Great 1080p LED 120hz 40" TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: DrOz "DrOz4u"
Reviews.Content: I just bought this tv yesterday and received it today, fast even for Amazon. It's LED and uses less energy than most which is a plus in my book. It is super thin and lightweight, the thin bezel looks great. I found it easy to mount the stand and set up as it is very light. I turned on the TV and the picture was near perfect to me, I dimmed the brightness a few notches but other than that it was good to go for me. The sound was a little off for me so I adjusted it a little to my liking and it sounds good to me. The remote is basic but pretty easy to use. I shopped around and this was the best value for the features you get and it looks great for the price point. I would definitely buy this tv again and would not hesitate to recommend it at all. The only complaint I have is that this TV only has 2 HDMI ports and I would have liked 3-4 at least.

Reviews.Title: Updated Review, Returning Product.
Reviews.Author: Gabriel
Reviews.Content: UPDATED REVIEW RETURNING PRODUCT:For a review of the materials, picture etc see the original review below my update. I suppose I should state this isn't an issue of me not being capable with website navigation/phone menu navigation etc I'm generally the person people call to do this kind of stuff when they're having trouble with it, I'm in my 20's and I've used the Internet since 14.4 dial up back in the early to mid 90's and have worked in offices and in tech support I'm pretty fluent in obscure automated phone menus and website navigation.Updated, dropping rating to 1 star which is unfortunately only partially the products issue and mostly Westinghouses but since it directly relates to the functionality of the product I'm left giving it 1 star. As stated in my original review I over all liked the product and I did end up straightening out the calibration to get a very nice picture out of this set. I however tried to hook my HD antenna up to this TV and was prompted with a need to enter an activation code to enable the tv tuner, I went to their website as it suggested and found that on 3 different browsers there is no way to enter information to activate via the website despite it clearly indicating that there is an easy way to activate. I then tried the automated cellphone text message system which responded to the initial inquiry then the only response given after that regardless of what was sent to it was that I needed to goto the website or call the 1-800 number. I called the 1-800 number and their automated system told me to goto the website then hung up on me. I called back and tried to speak with a representative, I was on hold for 30 minutes then sent to a voicemail... on hold with no indication of how long I would be on hold or even any sort hold music or anything to indicate I was in fact still on hold just dead silence broken every 10 minutes by an automated voice telling me that most problems can be solved by going to their website. Calling back again gave me a busy signal at 2 in the afternoon in their time zone, which would be the first time I've even gotten a busy signal off a 1-800 number from a large company. Calling back again put me on hold for 16 minutes then hung up on me. So I ignored the information given on the TVs setup wizard and looked on the website for different contact info, website lists the same phone number as the TV but also supplies an e-mail so I sent my information to the suggested e-mail and was sent a code within a few minutes without any issues at all the TV says this code is invalid but the e-mail did promptly return a code anyways. I probably could keep wasting my time on this but since I'm still waiting on a response from the e-mail I sent trying to find out if this model allows 120hz to be turned on/of I'm opting to return it before something else happens that requires me to attempt to deal with customer service again since it seems your options are broken automated systems or voicemail as there don't seem to be any actual humans to respond to e-mails or answer phones.ORIGINAL REVIEW:General unboxing impressions: As with some other reviewers I was surprised by the general appearance of the TV the nearly non existent faux brushed metal (actually plastic but looks nice) bezel around the screen with the solid metal back this TV looks expensive.Assembly: Then you put the stand on... stand looks pretty standard when it's sitting still and I'm not concerned about the TV toppling over as the absolute stability seems fine but the slightest tap or bump will make the entire TV wobble and you can literally bend the ends of the stand using no effort at all with your fingers, there is a metal plate in the center that supports where the screws go up into the TV and the forward back stability seems fine it's simply quite wobbly side to side. The stand is also smooth shiny plastic which is in contrast to the faux brushed metal of the bezel that sits a couple inches above it... it looks pretty mismatched like your tv came without a stand so you just went with whatever you found that happened to bolt up to it.Remote: The remote is among the cheapest looking I've ever seen as well, it appears out of place by a couple decades at least... like they just were figuring out plastic so it's all sharp edges and boxy design none of the sleek sexy curves of modern remotes. It also feels a little backwards because the thick end is the front and the thin end the rear which is the reverse of I'm pretty certain any remote I've ever used in my life... The buttons are interesting as well since about 80% are labeled with words or numbers and the other 20% switch to sometimes bizarre symbols such as the "Menu" button which is what appears to be lined cornerless paper that mysteriously has a mouse cursor on it. The remote also isn't faux brushed metal or shiny plastic it's just dull matte slightly textured plastic so it matches neither the bezel nor the stand.Screen: Screen is fantastic looking not too shiny that it reflects everything and not so dull that it looks bad. It fits the bezel perfectly with the high end appearance.First impressions turning it on: I have a dead pixel, it's the first thing I specifically check during the black screen before I even set up the inputs. My dead pixel happens to be about a 1/2 centimeter or so from the right side in the middle of the screen and it's 1 single pixel not an entire pixel cluster as is common. It's completely unnoticeable unless you're within 1-2 feet of the screen and are specifically looking for it so I basically have no dead pixels since it's completely impossible to see from any distance you would be viewing from.Inputs: love/hate with input placement. I can be a pain to plug in HDMI's because they're on the bottom of the back instead of a side as most I've hooked up are. The advantage to them being on the bottom though is they are completely out of the way and you can hook and unhook all the other random connections without messing with the ones that are pretty much always left in 24/7. You can also run the HDMI cables whichever direction you want without any problems because they start out headed straight down.Sound: No idea, use externals. Will update if I ever get around to testing the built-in speakers.Picture: this would be my main complaint, It's not specifically a bad picture it just requires a ton of calibration and tweaking to not be a bad picture... the defaults out of the box are some of the worst I've ever dealt with, you can literally change them all by just 1 click and very dramatically improve the picture. To get a good picture you have to change them by a lot more than 1 click but the fact that simply 1 click dramatically improves it makes me wonder why the defaults are so bad in the first place. Expect to spend some serious time tweaking this to your liking, I spent about an hour with some basic calibration images and am now pretty happy with the picture but it still seems off. This isn't me being overly picky about it being perfect either, this is the first TV I've ever had that I spent more than a few minutes messing with the settings to get a picture I was happy with. After spending an hour with this one I'm still at the point of looking at it and thinking it needs more calibration, it's pretty good at this point but still needs work. The clarity of the image is great but the colors, brightness, contrast, etc all need significant calibration before it looks even close to right.Over all, I'm pretty satisfied with the purchase assuming it doesn't die in a couple months or something the 4 star rating will stand. The review seems somewhat negative but I should state the stand and remote and such don't bother me, I would much rather more manufacturers focus on the main use of the product and ignore the peripherals, a TV is a screen for me anything else is bonus. I like the nice bezel because it's essentially part of the screen so doesn't hurt that it looks good as well, the stand the remote, whether the speakers are good or not doesn't matter to me since those aren't what I notice on a TV I'm generally busy watching the screen and it's the only thing I can't easily fix by buying some other cheap product to supplement it. I may lower the rating if after further calibration the picture still looks off as it may simply be that the color gamut on the screen is not capable of providing an accurate image in which case 4 stars seems too high. For now though I'm assuming it's calibration since every basic calibration thing I've done so far has continued to improve the image more and more to the point that it currently looks quite good, so it seems likely that it's just an issue of needing to get the right calibration for it to look even better and not any inability of the hardware to produce a truly fantastic picture.

Reviews.Title: Great bang for your buck
Reviews.Author: skaughtz
Reviews.Content: When I saw this TV on sale for $300 on Cyber Monday, I pounced on it.  Now that I have opened it up and tested it, even at the $370 it is currently selling for it is absolutely worth it.  Check around and you'll see that it is hard to find a television with these features at this price (especially LED-backlit and at 120Hz).Some people are concerned about buying "off brands," and rightfully so, because you tend to get what you pay for.  However, televisions are manufactured very similar to computer components.  That is, there are really only a few manufacturers that produce all of the inner workings of TVs, both name brand and off brand.  For instance, this particular model of Westinghouse is the same as Toshiba.  Emerson is the same as Samsung.  Etc.  Quality control is the same for all makes and models when they are leaving the factory.  The only real benefit to buying a name brand television is that you get a longer warranty, more innate features (many of which you probably won't need/use), and a better aesthetic look that conveys that this is a Sony, darn it.But now a quick run down of the important aspects:-Picture:  You will not find a better picture unless you are willing to spend several hundreds of dollars more than the cost of this model.  Even then, unless you are extremely particular about your A/V equipment, I'm not sure how much of an improvement you would notice.  The first thing I do with a new television is turn on the first sport I can find in HD to see how clear and crisp the picture is.  At 120Hz there was no lag to the soccer game I was watching and the picture was great.  Football should look beautiful.-LED Backlight:  LCD televisions are typically lit in one of two ways: Light-Emitting Diode (LED) or Cold Cathode Fluorescent Lamp (CCFL).  CCFL is cheaper to produce, less reliable, has a shorter lifespan, consumes more energy and produces more heat than LED.  The CCFL is often what goes up first in a television.  This model has LED.  Score one for the $300 television.-Sound:  Is it THX surround sound?  No.  Should it suffice perfectly for the average person?  Yes.  Sound quality is really a subjective thing... some people still prefer vinyl over CDs.  I think the sound on this television is fine, and really no different from other televisions I have owned.  If you want huge sound, there is an entire industry dedicated to fulfilling your audio needs.-Stand:  I don't like this design.  It is plenty study enough, but it requires the television to be horizontal in order to mount the stand.  Four long screws connect the stand to the television.  A tongue and groove method (or something similar) would have been much simpler, but I'm just nitpicking.Would I purchase this television again?  Absolutely.  If you are considering it I suggest that you do the same.  You simply aren't going to find these options at this price anywhere else.  Or, you can pay much, much more for a name brand logo on the front of the television.  Your call.

Reviews.Title: Good for the money - but has a color issue.
Reviews.Author: Mark Twain "goldteef"
Reviews.Content: The TV works well and was great value for the money spent. I give it 4 stars because the color is difficult to manage. Even after adjusting - the colors are still a bit off. I'm only using it as a gaming monitor so I'm not terribly bothered by it.

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: Naobi Lantigua
Reviews.Content: I've had a Westinghouse for 10years. And its still like new!!! I've NEVER had a problem with it. I think the picture and quality looks good. I love it so much I bought another one! I can't complain at all. Especially about the price.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: Spencer S.
Reviews.Content: Honestly, this TV looks good. It's cheap, its good quality, and the build looks pretty cool. The picture quality isn't great but what do you expect for a TV at such a bargain. I will say this. The remote has a YPbPr1 and YPbPr2 input button, and is advertised as having component input. IT DOES NOT! There is no RGYB input connectors for component. Kind of disappointing for someone who has a Wii and wants better than standard RCA. That ticked me off! However, it is a good buy overall.

Reviews.Title: Not 3D capable. No volume control on audio out!! Great PC/VGA input support and warranty service!!
Reviews.Author: shar-a-la-cour
Reviews.Content: Can't say this is an unbiased review seeing as how we got ours for only 200$ - we originally opted for a used 32" 768p westinghouse TV here on amazon about a year ago which failed. This is what we got it replaced with under warranty!!! So we're pretty happy.PROS:- Read another review which points out that it does very well with fast moving video - no "trails".- I was just messing around with the PC/VGA input and was pleasantly surprised to see it manage 1600x900, regardless of what the manual and the fact that the TV reads it as 1440x900, which is irksome. See customer photos. It's definitely 1600x900 1:1 not scaled. Really nice if you don't have HDMI.- Seems to be well priced.CONS:- AFAIK this is NOT a 3D capable TV, it simply runs at 120hz and does not accept a 3D 120hz input signal.- My biggest complaint: I hooked up my stereo via the RCA output, thinking I could have my cake and eat it to - I thought I'd be able to control the volume and mute the stereo with the remote. No luck! I don't understand how they screwed this up. Really defeats the point of audio over HDMI although without commercials it's not too irritating. It DOES control the audio of BOTH the internal and external speakers ONLY IF YOU LEAVE THE INTERNAL SPEAKERS ON. So I guess it's alright if you have a loud stereo and turn it all the way up or if your stereo is lacking in treble lol...- The contrast ratio as stated by the review is actually only 1514:1. The color accuracy is not great but it's ok for a budget TV, better than your average laptop LCD. My laptop however supposedly has around 90% color gamut (sony Z) and it's noticeably better, as is my phone (galaxy ace 2 super PLS) although it's a glossy screen while the UW40T2BW is matte.- As many others point out, IT DOES NOT HAVE VESA STANDARD 200mm X 200mm MOUNTING.

Reviews.Title: Ghost TV
Reviews.Author: 60wattsaloon
Reviews.Content: Very good picture & well priced.  Slow as molasses for turning on or changing channels.  The strange thing is that it will just turn on by itself sometimes & we don't have a ghost.  Big pic for the price but not a primary tv for the house.

Reviews.Title: Best TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Hamilton
Reviews.Content: Great! Great! Great! I'm so surprised that this TV is of such good quality for this price. We have ROKU hooked up to it and I love it.

Reviews.Title: Simply the best for your buck.....
Reviews.Author: DJamez
Reviews.Content: Alot of people are hesitant to buy a Westinghouse set, I understand that. Ive got a 5 year old Westinghouse LCD still going strong though, so buying this was a no brainer for me. With Westinghouse you get a great(not good) picture, its that simple. DirecTVHD, and especially 1080P Blu Ray look just awesome. It simply lacks in the bells in whistles department, but your paying less than half the cash here for a comparable LED. These sets are perfect for bedrooms, and family rooms. For a large living room I go with Panasonic, Sony etc. for more inputs, and flexibility.Westinghouse improved the speakers in there sets by going with Yamaha, that would be the only knock on my 5 year old LCD. The speakers were just ok, where as with this LED theyre very good. No flat screen made has great speakers anyway in my opinion, so you can always go the soundbar/amp route.Ive seen reviews stating wall mounting problems.....i dont wall mount these so I cant comment on that. The stand is great, and attached very easily. Setting the picture is EASY....alot of people overstate calibrating a set. This is an LED here....just make sure you select home , and not retail use on the first screen. From there make it pleasant to your eye. This isnt a Plasma, and burn in is a non issue 99.9% of the time.

Reviews.Title: Small problem
Reviews.Author: Jack OBrien
Reviews.Content: TV turns on by itself. Problem with the power button on the bezel, it doesn't work all the time. You have to play with it to get it to work. Costs too much to send back...I will have to live with the problem.Picture is not bad, actually pretty nice. Aside the problems...not a bad buy.

Reviews.Title: Westinghouse uw4052bw hdtv
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent tv for the money.  The picture is excellent, the set-up is straightforward and the price is right!  It doesn't have all the bells and whistles that the more expensive tv's have, but you will not be disappointed with the overall quality of this tv.  I would purchase another one from Amazon.com without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: Replaces a smaller LCD
Reviews.Author: Beamish Nine "Beamish"
Reviews.Content: Fast shipping. Easy to set-up.Good price. Excellent picture quality.Plugged it in, connected cable box andthe tv made all the adjustments.So far all I have done is turn on/off andchange stations.

Reviews.Title: Cheap but nice
Reviews.Author: Michael Sullivan
Reviews.Content: Picked this up for just over $300 after tax. Extremely light compared to other LCD tvs of a smaller size. Picture looks very nice, using it as a monitor and can read text on it fine. Only has 2 HDMI on it though, but that is my only complaint.

Reviews.Title: This TV is awesome
Reviews.Author: James Jorgensen
Reviews.Content: I got this at the black Friday sale on Amazon.What a great TV, the quality is great.The sound is very nice, picture quality is great.A wonderful TV to buy for a small family

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Kin Cheuk "Kin"
Reviews.Content: I'll keep it short.- 40" LED TV- 120 Hz- Decent Sound from the speakers- PriceAmazing Deal.

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy If You Want to Wall Mount!
Reviews.Author: jlogant
Reviews.Content: Just got this yesterday, and I should have read the reviews about the mounting issues.  The connections will be blocked by the mounting bracket, so you have to use some sort of spacers to move the bracket out.  You will also need longer screws than what are probably supplied by your wall mount manufactuer. Now instead of a nice, solid, flat against the back mount, you have this sort of cantilevered set up.  Not the ideal set up for an expensive piece of electronic equipment that you are hoping to not have fall off the wall! Fortunately, it is fairly light, so I think I will be OK, but who knows?  Also, you will still struggle with making your wired connections, because of their location underneath the now remoted bracket. I got this on a Cyber Monday deal, so the price was right, but if I had to do it all over again, I think I would have looked a little longer.

Reviews.Title: Terrible
Reviews.Author: Pecos Bill
Reviews.Content: This is probably the worst TV I have ever owned.  The remote quit working about 2 months after I got it.  I was told to ship it to California and they would fix it.  OK all is well except the shipping and crating cost almost $200 and I only paid $322 for the TV.  Do not think that you are buying from the old standard of Westinghouse quality.  They sold the name to a Chinese co. that truly does not care about the people that buy their product. OH and by the way the picture quality is also very poor.

Reviews.Title: Awful TV
Reviews.Author: Svetlana Parizh
Reviews.Content: This TV is awful.  I bought it on Amazon for during the lightning deals, so it was a good deal.  So we thought.  After 2 days of use, while watching the TV would just go bananas asking us to reconnect the wires.  We returned it and received a new set.  Same problem again, except now we had volume that would magically increase on its own.  Once again we exchanged it.  So now we are on our 3rd TV, the volume problem has happened twice in the past 2 weeks.  It's been a few days so we're hoping it will just stop.  Anyway, awful TV.  Waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Nice Looking TV.  Good Picture, but Mediocre Sound. Still Good Value for The Price Tag.
Reviews.Author: Carrie
Reviews.Content: This Westinghouse TV was a pleasant surprise.  Not only is the TV as slim as advertised (& much less weight than a comparable LCD TV), it has a nice aesthetic.  The Westinghouse "W" is not too large and, when on, there is a small red light that is underneath the logo (it doesn't have the logo glow on the front like many TVs).THE GOOD1. The picture is good - good color & good contrast/brightness - not washed out.2. The menu set up is easy to operate.3. Hook-up to a digital antenna was a breeze & the TV recognized all of the available digital channels (I have to go online to get a code to input into the TV in order to get this done, though).4. Hook-up to a Roku was easyTHE NOT SO GOOD1. The remote is smallish & lightweight with a lot of buttons crammed together.  It isn't the greatest remote.2. While the stand has a large spread, and there are 4 screws in the base of the TV, the stand is wobbly and the TV really needs to sit on a solid surface.3. The back of the TV needs a new design.  Not only are the mount holes in a poor location (you are going to need a wall mount that has spacers), the power plug is at the top of all of the other inputs (my other TVs have the power location near the bottom & away from the rest of the inputs).  Additionally, the power isn't just a plug - it has an ac/dc adapter that will need to be secured to something because it probably won't reach the ground.4. The sound is OK. The speakers are behind the TV, so the sound is muffled.  When running on a treadmill, I have to push the sound to the limit & it is still a little soft. In comparison, a 37" Vizio only needs to have the sound at under halfway in order for me to hear it well.Even with the "Not So Good", I like the TV.  It is a nice, good-looking TV for the price, and for those who are just TV watchers & not techno nitpickers, it is a good pick.

Reviews.Title: Good photo, good sound
Reviews.Author: JDTinOR
Reviews.Content: A very solid, no frills TV. My usage - wall mounted in my exercise room so we can watch or listen to something while working out.  Primary used to watch sports or music.  Does well for both.  We don't use it for movies and such as the "exercise room" is the 3rd bay of the garage!I personally like the simple remote control even though now, it has been superseded by the satellite remote.  Does well with fast action and the colors are vibrant.  The sound is as full as I can expect for using the TV's speakers - reasonable TV speaker bass.  Don't know how the screen does with glare or from severe angles but in an environment with neon florescent lighting and moderate viewing angles, it shows well.You really shouldn't get too concerned about the mounting.  I went with the suggestion of a previous reviewer, bought some 1" pvc f2f sleeves, some extra long screws, and was willing to drill 4 simple holes in the cheapest mounting bracket I found on Amazon and it mounts fine.  Yes, running to the hardware store, taking a little extra to have to align holes and mark where to drill, etc, all amounts to a couple more hours to mount, but I'm glad I went with a $29 universal mount versus the $99 mount that would not have required drilling (but still would have required the sleeve and longer screws.)I don't think any review, mine included, is not at its most useful until the product has been owned and used a while and you can speak to reliability, so know that I am only reviewing the initial experience over the delivery, install and first 2 weeks of usage.

Reviews.Title: HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE
Reviews.Author: richard Wall
Reviews.Content: I bought this product on December 17th, 2013.  It stopped working on March 20, 2014.  Went online to their Customer service and sent an e-mail as requested...NO RESPONSE.  Went online again...NO RESPONSE.  Called, they advised they had my e-mails and I needed to send a copy of my receipt..did so...NO RESPONSE.  Called back again, they said it was covered and I had to pay to ship it to them and they would have it replaced in two weeks.  That was on April 7, 2014..Two weeks later, no tv, no call.  Called again and was advised it was back ordered and it would be two more weeks.  Waited two more weeks, NO RESPONSE.  Called and asked to speak to a supervisor, left a message...NO RESPONSE.  Called back four hours later during business houes, and supervisor was gone for the day...after another week with NO RESPONSE..Sent complaint to corporate Headquarters, they responded and advised they were still back ordered, but would send me a 39" (smaller, less expensive model) in THREE MORE WEEKS.  Called back and asked for a supervisor.  NO RESPONSEDO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT. Anyone can get a lemon, but Westinghouse Digital does not provide proper service.

Reviews.Title: My new favorite thing
Reviews.Author: Philip Smith
Reviews.Content: This TV kicks major backside.  If you want a barebones TV with no Apps (my bluray player has all I need) and a Great picture, than look no further! This is the one for you!

Reviews.Title: Good TV, but...
Reviews.Author: E. jameson
Reviews.Content: The TV itself is decent for the price and I've had Westinghouse TVs and computer monitors before, so the quality and durability is typically very good.The problem here, which you may have read on other reviews is the mounting system.If you plan on just leaving the TV on a stand and have no need to mount the TV on the wall, then feel free to purchase this television and you should be fine.If you plan on mounting this TV on the wall, go get another TV.For the money you save purchasing this 1080p 120Hz refresh LED set, you will spend that money in messing around with finding the right wall mount and eventually you will have to go get longer screws.The computer hardware is right in the center of the back of the TV, under a raised bezel. It sits almost right on top of the mounting screw holes, so NO WALL MOUNTS will sit securely on these screws. I don't care if you search Amazon and other sites looking for a wall mount that states it specifically supports this TV. It doesn't. I've already checked them out and they are the same as anything else.In the end, I tried two different wall mounts that said they were for this TV and yet I still had to follow the other reviewer's suggestions and go to a hardware store to purchase:1 1/2 " spacersand four screws that were:  M6-1.00 x 40These are metric screws and I had to get them 1.5" long (40mm) to fit the spacers and give enough clearance to the power input and HDMI cables, because the genius who designed this TV has the inputs on the side of the raise spot in the back, so even if the mount sat right on top of the screw holes, like normal VESA TVs, you wouldn't be able to plug anything in.The TV is a good set, so it gets 3 stars, but the design and pain that go with the mounting system is so bad that honestly, I would have been better off just getting a regular TV where the manufacturer used standard VESA specs that have been around for years, instead of trying to get cute.

Reviews.Title: Bought this over a year ago
Reviews.Author: Annida Clark
Reviews.Content: We bought the Westinghouse 40 inch tv about a year ago as a treat for christmas. I'm pleased with it. We've had it a year, had no problems with it, and really enjoy using it. It fits perfectly in its alcove.

Reviews.Title: Great screen for the price
Reviews.Author: Jane Noe
Reviews.Content: I have no idea how well the tv works but the screen is great for playing xbox. I found one on sale for 249....best screen around at this price.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal!
Reviews.Author: tas
Reviews.Content: This was a spontaneous purchase I have to admit with no research done as I normally would on electronics.  However, it has surpassed my expectations and one of the best TVs in our house.  The quality is great and the price was amazing.  Really happy this was one quick purchase that worked out for the better.

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: Joseph B.
Reviews.Content: this product has a great price, great picture, doesn't take up as much room as we thought we replaced our 36" regular tube tv with this one and it takes up less room, as it is closer to the wall,  The picture is what you would hope to get with a LED TV..

Reviews.Title: Great Value, Fantasic HD
Reviews.Author: Ron Ward
Reviews.Content: This is a great everyday Family TV.  I watch a lot of sports and this is PERFECT.  Sound is 4/5, not action movie in a theater quality but if you have surround sound, which I do not, I guess it doesn't matter.  The HD refresh is amazing and I lvoe it.  Perfect size and the stand is perfect for my fireplace mantle.  100% recommended!!!!

Reviews.Title: A Solid Off-brand TV with Audio (and a Few Other) Issues
Reviews.Author: The Brantasm "BA"
Reviews.Content: By off-brand I mean a TV that isn't top-tier like Sony, Samsung and the like. My mind works better in pros in cons so I'll list it out for you.Cons:- The audio is terrible. From the middle of the volume level to its peak, there is little to no change. There is no headphone jack to plug in smaller external speakers, so I bought a stereo (red and white) cable adapter to plug in my own speakers. Even after that, the TV cannot control the volume of the external speakers like you would want it to. I have no clue why they didn't just make a mini input for headphones.- At first my TV would change inputs by itself. Like, literally change by itself with nothing touching it. It was embarrassing to have company over, be watching a movie through an HDMI input, and all of a sudden the screen starts showing regular TV channels. My girlfriend advised me to replace it, but the TV is so large that I didn't want to go through the hassle. I'm glad I let it work that kink out because it hasn't done it since the end of 2012.- My TV seems to have some kind of static, phantom thing going on with the buttons. Hovering your finger near the volume, power, etc. buttons causes them to activate and act as if you are actually touching them. It's pretty annoying, I wish they would have just made solid buttons to press to negate this issue.-  The connections are a hassle to get to because they are both on the back and under a portion of the TV set. Not a big deal unless you plan on moving a lot of cables around.-  If you like total darkness, you won't be able to see the remote because there is no glow-in the dark feature for it.Pros:- You can't beat the nearly $200 price difference between this TV and a "name-brand".- It has a great picture and really allows a good contrast at times.- Multiple HDMI ports.- The TV is sleek and really blends in well in a contemporary room. It's impressive and really doesn't scream "I'm not a Samsung".Overall, I'd say buy it, test drive it, and see if it fits. It's worked well for me and I've owned it since December 2012. I will update this if I have anymore issues, but assume that everything has been alright since then.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Dylan Begley
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up, decent sound for a cheap TV.  I thought it had component inputs...ordered it partially because of that.  But I'm not going to knock off one star because of something that is my own oversight :)

Reviews.Title: LED westinghouse tv
Reviews.Author: Beatrice J. Prokop "golfer"
Reviews.Content: Just perfect great  price and fast delivery...Easy to set up and light in weight.Nice clarity for the picture and has a clock

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: MoBowhunter
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the price.  I have friends who spent twice as much for TVs and like this one better.  I am very satisfied with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Perfect fit in my 1 BR apartment
Reviews.Author: Honest Joe
Reviews.Content: Perfect size and picture quality for any room. Use in connection with DISH satellite TV, adapts well and performs flawlessly.

Reviews.Title: So far, decent bedroom TV..
Reviews.Author: GBaker
Reviews.Content: I got this TV on a Black Friday special anticipating re-doing the bedroom and up-sizing to this 40 inch TV.  I finally got it up and wall mounted yesterday. I used Cheetah Mount model APDAM2B and it worked fine - but I did have to use lots of spacers due to the odd mount positions on the TV.  Oh - and make sure you have the power cord and all the components plugged in before you hang it as the brackets make those ports hard to access.  You can do it, but it would be a bear after it was hung.It looks great hanging on a wall.  The only complaint I have is the power light is meant to shine into the base stand and its VERY bright on the wall below the TV.  I'm going to fix that with small piece of electrical tape.  You can turn the power light off, but I want a bit of light to know if its powered on or not because...This TV doesn't easily pair with Directv remotes and I can't find codes for it anywhere.  Most functions work but not the power on/off that controls both the tv and receiver.  I'll have to power them both down separately.  Annoying, but not a deal breaker.So far, I like the picture. I'm still tweaking the settings, but its not bad for the price.  I like to play and this doesn't have a lot of custom options, but the quality is good enough to keep me happy.  The sound is better than I expected, but I'll be connecting a sound bar this weekend.

Reviews.Title: Best $300 I ever spent
Reviews.Author: HappyHubby
Reviews.Content: Cant beat the price and the quality. If you are looking for a cinematic experience look elsewhere. If you need a good TV for daily use, movies, tv, sports, etc and the occasional blueray; this is the move for you.

Reviews.Title: Great TV/Computer Monitor
Reviews.Author: Andrew Horton
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that when I first saw this TV, I was hesitant to buy it since I don't know anyone with a Westinghouse TV and so far I have only bought Samsung TV's.  For the price though, it was hard to resist, and I am glad that I went with this TV.  So far I haven't really noticed differences between this one and the Samsung with similar specs that I have, and this one was so much cheaper.I also wanted to point out that the TV does make for a great computer monitor.  I don't actually use the PC connector on the TV, I bought an HDMI to DVI cable instead, but I also only have great things to say about using the TV as a monitor.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: Joey Gallo
Reviews.Content: I couldn't be happier, good value and great quality. The only thing I disliked was the volume limit, the unit doesn't get very loud, but that can be solved with an audio system. Would recommend to anyone on a budget looking for a good quality decent sized HDTV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a low cost
Reviews.Author: Pat
Reviews.Content: I was looking to replace my dinosaur Toshiba projector TV and this came across my lap on Groupon.Upon first arrival it looked great; slim, lightweight and stylish. Although all I was looking for was a cheap 1080p replacement.Sound is fine for the TV and the picture is good too. My only gripe with the TV is with the Xbox, to use a surround sound system and HDMI, it resets the Xbox when you flip over to the HDMI. And also programming the SYNERGY V remote with RCN.Other than that, the TV works great, still works great.

Reviews.Title: My first flat screen
Reviews.Author: Janice Jaros
